questions.question: Question 1: What is the correct order for the process of communication?
questions.explanation:
The correct order for the process of communication is: SenderMessageChannelReceiverFeedback The sender (communicator) is the originator of the message. A message is the information which 
the communicator transmits to his audience. Channel is the media of communication between the 
sender and the receiver (e.g., interpersonal communication, mass media, traditional or folk 
media). The audience who receives, understands, and acts upon the message is called the 
receiver. Feedback is the reaction to the message which flows from the receiver to the sender.

questions.question: Question 4: Which of the following statements is not true about mass media?

options.a: It has increased influence only in below-average educated population
options.b: It gives greater support for concentrated programmes
options.c: Mass media alone is inadequate in changing human behavior
options.d: Mass media reaches the widest population

questions.explanation:
The advantage of mass media includes that it has increased influence across all educational levels, 
especially in above-average educational level. Mass media includes TV, newspaper, radio, etc. • Advantages: • It reaches people even in the most remote areas. • It gets public attention. • It has increased influence across all educational levels, especially in above-average educational 
level. • It gives greater support for concentrated programmes. • Disadvantages: • One-way communication • Impersonal method and no face-to-face contact • Mass media alone is inadequate in changing human behavior.

questions.question: Question 6: Which of the following is not an approach to health education?
questions.explanation:
Socio-environmental approach is not an approach to health education. There are four approaches to health education: Regulatory approach- external control or laws placed on people by the government. Ex: Child 
Marriage Act, No smoking in public places, Helmet law Service approach- government aims at providing health services to the people at their doorsteps. 
Its drawback is that people will not accept a service, even if it is offered free of cost unless it is 
based on their felt needs. Ex: Government provided latrines free of cost yet people did not use 
them because its need was not felt Health education approach- creates awareness of health needs and problems. Awareness leads to 
motivation which includes the stages of interest, evaluation, and decision-making. It is followed 
by acceptance of the new idea which becomes part of his existing values, known as internalization. 
Ex: Adoption of ORS for diarrhea Primary health care approach- delivery of health services with the active involvement of people. 
Principles of community participation and intersectoral coordination are stressed here. Its 
objective is to help individuals become self-reliant in health matters. Ex: People receive guidance 
from healthcare providers (Rogi Kalyana Samiti, Mahila Arogya Samiti).

questions.question: Question 7: In which model of health education does internalization occur?
questions.explanation:
719 
Sold by @itachibot Internalization belongs to the motivation model. There are three models of health education: • Medical model: transfer of proven medical information into education. It does not bridge the gap 
between knowledge and behavior. • Motivation model: creates awareness of health needs and problems. Awareness leads 
to motivation which includes stages of interest, evaluation, and decision-making. It is followed by 
acceptance of the new idea which becomes part of his existing values, known as internalization. • Social intervention model: focuses on changing the social environment which subsequently 
shapes the behavior of individual and the community.

questions.question: Question 8: Which of the following is not a principle of health education?
questions.explanation:
Drawing conclusions is not a principle of health education. Principles of Health Education: • Participation • Learning by doing • Setting an example • Good human relations • Feedback • Credibility • Leaders • Interest • Comprehension • Known to unknown • Motivation • Reinforcement Known to unknown means to start where the people are and with what they understand and then 
proceed to new knowledge.

antibiotics. What is this method of group communication known as?
questions.explanation:

communication, in which the chalk is the visual component. It is also known as lectures. Flannelgraphs, flipcharts, exhibits, films, and charts come under this

questions.question:
Question 12: A group discussion was conducted among villagers to assess their knowledge on personal 
hygiene. Which of the following statements is false regarding this format of health education?

options.a: Many different topics can be spoken about in one discussion
options.b: A group leader guides the conversation
options.c: It can bring about change in the attitude of participants
options.d: It usually consists of 6 to 12 people

questions.explanation:
A group discussion discusses one topic on its agenda. Group discussion is an aggregation of people interacting in a face-to-face manner. Exchange of 
ideas, knowledge, and opinions is done by participants which influence a change in their attitudes. It usually involves 6–12 people with a group leader who guides the conversation, giving equal 
opportunity to everyone to voice themselves. In a group discussion, everyone must speak and be 
open to criticism without interrupting others. A limitation to this form of health education is that not everyone is open to speaking in public. 
There is also a high possibility of diversion of the topic of discussion when many people are 
involved. Methods of Health Communi

questions.question: Question 13: Which of the following is false about panel discussion?

options.a: It usually consists of four to eight experts
options.d: Members of the audience are invited to take part at the end

questions.explanation:
A moderator is required to regulate the panel discussion. In a panel discussion, 4 to 8 experts have a discussion on a topic in front of an audience. 
No speeches or order is set beforehand. The audience is invited to take part after the panelists 
speak and ask questions.

questions.question:
Question 15: The Indian Association of Paediatrics is organizing a workshop on neonatal resuscitation. 
Which of the following best describes this program?

options.a: Discussion of 4-8 experts in front of an audience
options.c: Series of four or more interactive meetings
options.d: Series of speeches on a given subject

questions.explanation:
A workshop is a series of meetings with an emphasis on individual work within the group, using 
external consultants or experts. It helps increase individual efficiency as a professional worker.

questions.question: Question 16: All of the following are types of combined audio-visual aids except:
questions.explanation:
Flannelgraphs, podcasts, and tape recorders are not combined audio-visual (A-V) aids. Flannelgraph is a rough flannel fixed over a wooden board used for displaying pictures, cut-outs, 
etc. It is only a visual aid. Podcasts and tape recorders are auditory aids. Audio-visual aids are classified into three groups: • Auditory aids: Radio, tape recorders, podcasts • Visual aids: Chalkboards, flannelgraphs, charts, posters, slides • Combined A-V aids: Cinema, television, slide-tape combination

questions.question:
Question 17: A Norovirus outbreak occurs in an urban slum where you are posted as the PHC medical 
officer. Which is the best method to teach the people about ORS?
questions.explanation:
The best method to teach an urban slum about ORS is by demonstrations. Demonstration is a carefully prepared presentation on how to perform a certain task or skill or 
procedure. It shows the step-by-step process of a task. It arouses interest and incites ‘learning by 
doing,’ and ‘seeing is believing’ philosophies. 723

questions.question:
Question 18: Which of the following is used to obtain consensus forecasts among a large number of 
people?
questions.explanation:
Delphi method is a systematic interactive forecasting method, which is used to obtain a consensus 
forecast among a large number of people. It determines the degree of agreement on a topic. This can help in setting priorities or selecting alternatives in planning. This method uses 
questionnaires, which are answered by experts in two or more rounds.

questions.question: Question 19: What is total communication used for?
questions.explanation:
The philosophy of total communication is used in the education of hearing-impaired children. It requires the incorporation of aural, oral, and manual modes of communication for effective 
communication with and among hearing-impaired people.

questions.question: Question 20: In which of the given scenarios would you use the GATHER approach?
questions.explanation:
The GATHER approach is mainly used for counseling, like in contraceptive counseling, wherein a 
person is helped to make a decision about health. GATHER stands for: • G – Greet • A – Ask • T – Tell options or give answers • H – Help in making choices • E – Explain everything about the decision • R – Return for follow-up
